botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause mild stomach upset, contact might irritate skin. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Scadoxus are bulbous, rhizomatous, usually evergreen perennials, with spirally arranged, lance-shaped or ovate leaves and erect stems bearing terminal umbels of showy red flowers sometimes with colourful bracts, followed by red to yellow berries

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant bulbs in late winter or early spring, with necks at soil level, in loam-based potting compost with added leaf mould and grit. Grow under glass in full light with shade from hot sun. Flowering will be prolonged if light levels are reduced when the buds open. Water freely when in growth and apply a dilute balanced liquid fertiliser monthly. Keep just moist when dormant and do not pot on regularly as flowering is best when congested
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown as soon as ripe and germinate at 19-24°C. Remove offsets in early spring
